Entry.1:
Informed by Brdgr, Col CF Cox CB, 1st LH Bde that on the marching out of the 1st & 2nd Regts for WARDAN, I was to take over all the details of the five units remaining at the Aerodrome Camp Heliopolis, with all material, equipment, etc on charge to the Bde & Regts: & to organise the personnel into a new Light Horse Reserve Rgt. of 3 sqdns of reinforcements & detats under a permanent cadre, & a 4th Sqdn. for the training & handing over horses to the 3 sqdns for further LH training & remount reinforcement.

The Regt to be a training & reinforcing depot for the Bde.

I am the unit commander concerned, & made what few arrangements were possible, under the circumstances of doubt as to to be left behind, & what material.

Asked the Bgdr. to give me a Med. Offr.

1.

1916

Jan 13th

Practically nothing could be done owing to the various units not being complete in rolls.

Marked out the future camp in the site occupied by the detats 3rd L. H. Counted accommodation in mess huts, latrines, & horse stalls.

Marked out limits of camp for the Remount Sqn. Brgdr. Made preliminary appointments (acting) & some of the perm. cadre.

14th

1st & 2nd Regts began to move out about 9 am. I took charge of units & material; & began moving camp. No regtl. state could be prepared as the five units did not all have rolls given them. Consequently if men left camp during the morning or early afternoon we could have no knowledge or record of them.

Made arrangements to borrow a Med. offr. a few hours per day for a few days from Lt. Col Horne. CO 4th LH Bde FA.

Tents could not be used & the men slept in various places in the old & new camps, cooking remained in unit cookshops till 
18th 
 when central 

2.

Jan

cooking was practicable. All QM stores have moved to new Regtl QM position. After dark 2 officers (Major Lewis, Lt Brooks) & 30 men arrived from England.

15

At 6 30 am parade the Regt in its new formation was formed up: The work from now was carried on in the new allotment of officers & NCOs. The continuation of moving & reorganisation was sufficiently good in the morning to allow of the usual Saturday afternoon omission of parade.

Captain Vernon 4th LHFA attended to sick parade.

Lt Mossop reports from 3rd Regt.

16 

Sunday

Compulsory parade in morning, those that preferred church services to fatigue being dressed cleanly & attending: all but about 30 attended or were on special duties & routine.

Informed that the details of the 4th LH. would be attached to the Regt.; no 
 detr
 communication from that regt itself. The correspondence showed that this Regt would occupy the camp of 1st LH Bde: Thus we could have occupied site of 1st & 2nd Regts.

Captain Vernon again .

3

1916

 Jan. 

17

State 
20
 25 Officers, included in the following:-

Hdqrts 
about
 20: A Sqn 277: B 264: C 316: Remount 191: total about 1068. 

At 6.30 PM the 13th reinf of 1st LH arrive & report: 1 Officer (Lt Chaffey) & 22 others.

Attended ADMS & reported no Med Offr. Also obtained his approval to Med Stores being issued at once brought into camp at 5.30 PM. Captain Vernon again lent.

Major Granville of 1st LH, visited camp to get more tents & . Saw how short we were & did not press the matter.

18

Called to Gen’l Spens office re an LH officer.

Gave instructions for the remount Sqn to occupy the ground of the 2nd LH: B Sqn to move into half of that of 1st LH: & D Sqn (4th LH) to be allotted the other half when it arrives

Capt Weir of 1st LH visited camp to get certain gear of Regt. & private goods: gave him 3 mess tables, 7 , (up to) 26 horse rugs, & some long tent pegs: also Regt Comforts etc.

Capt Mills of 3rd LH brought chit from Lt Col Fulton. 

4

Jan

Asking for 1 Sgt 1 / 1 Cpl by name & 40 men (MEF if possible)

At my request he wired Bgdr to confirm.

19th 

Capt Prideaux Brune 1st LH reported for duty, less attendance at a Court Martial appointed to.

Moving of Remount & B Sqns effected.

Called on Gen Spens with information he asked for – he was out.

Purchased 1800 colour patches 600 each of A.B.C.

Col Tedder claimed the Cadillac car in the street. Lt Mackenzie of Motor Corps wrote for it.

Lt Burns Bde O.O. was in camp.

20th 

Drew out a Regt Parade all ‘unfits’ & B men.

Then all specialists, Farriers, Saddlers, armourers, M.G. , Tailors, trumpeters, various NCOs, & began to form the permanent cadre & attached Specialists of the Regt.

Called on Gen Spens to ask if we could not keep Bde car: he promised we could. 

5

1916 

Jan 21st 

Further organizing of personnel.

Major P. Vaughan, LH, to rejoin his unit while awaiting his new position, came on to the strength for rations & tentage, but not duty.

Major Bisley V.C., with Lts Beck, Bare, & Dobson arrived with 414 of other ranks: of these the 4th & 5th reinforcements of the 12th LH were immediately attached to ‘A’ Sqn.

14 men two up school after several warnings & note in orders: 96 hrs C.B. ea..

22nd

 Saturday

Completed personnel recommendations list.

As the 12th LH reinfents of the 6th & 7th portions of 12th LH were sent under my charge I went to Maadi for information as to all the details of the 2nd LH Bde: but could get none.

1st LH Bde were for 3 officers & 40 others for 3rd LH instructed to prepare draft for "C" Sqn

 23rd 

Notice that Brdr Col Cox CB. to arrive Monday Lt Whitfield reports: allotted to ‘B’ (11th LH) All papers, & recommendations completed.

6

Jan 24th

Col Cox arrived 10.45 am: inspected the Regt on parade: state about 1600 odd. During inspection Gen Birdwood with Col Wagstaff arrived & inspected: till 1PM. The parade was particularly steady: clothing in all states: boots fair good throughout: arms very short: generally men & leather clean. Asked Bdgr for right to continue sorting the Bde letters here. Handed him Report & recommendations to personnel & other matters.

During the day Lts Bartley & Johnston & others of
Entry.2:
LH reinforcements for ‘B’ Sqn reported. 

Col Farr apps of Regt Paymaster System if Bdg does.

Following almost daily showers for the past few weeks, a heavy storm flooded certain tents nights 24 25.
Entry.5: LH from Aerodrome Guard Room: he had been there about 6 weeks: the FGCM had awarded him 3 day detention.
Entry.6:
QM Hockey & VO Guyer in camp with authority to take stores.

Received cable from Mrs Vernon sending £30.00 in answer to my appeal for ‘A’ Sqn (cost 90 PP)

Attended Garrison office Zeitown; saw Col Hall & Capt Phillips who promised mess huts, latrines, tents to their ability.

Being Anniversary Day the 2.30 parade was handed over to Sqn Cmdrs to dismiss if they did not require the men.
Entry.8:
Went to Major T J Lynch & Lt P Potts, Austr. Overseas Base Gherzich & Ghizeh.

Official opening of Mess with a Great night.
Entry.9: Adjt. Lt. Norris 2nd LH sent for by Major Glasgow: apptd Lt Mossop with Lt Chaffey as assistant Adgt.
Entry.10:
Sunday

Todays state 1935: Church parade 1750(?) Motored to Maadi with Vaughan to see Geof: require another Med Off.

 Bus & a LH Regt sent out in connection with Egyptian reservists mobilization.
Entry.11:
Musketry classes going. Major Granville called at Nile Cold Storage.

Cadillac car peremptorily called in & report asked for by GOC as to why I did not do it before. I had had Gen’l Spens promise, & Bde instructions.

Went to town – Major Maxted: Stein & B.C. Patches. Budden: Capt Belfield; Major Taylor: tools: trumpet mouthpieces

Lt Norris left 5 a.m. with horses for WARDAN

1916
Entry.12:
Action taken during night in case of C.L. Johnston.

Col C.F. Cox arrived in camp 10.15 am.

Looked carefully into Nile Cold Storage Co’s contract

Offer by YMCA to run day canteen & restaurant

Bottle of whiskey sold to a man by N.C.S. Co.
Entry.13: Staff Capt Chisholm in camp: took certain gear from QM.
Entry.15: Guest night: Lt Col Cinch: Majr Roberts: several 3rd LH Bac visitors & infty: Gandy: Hogg. Cpl Cutler laid up.
Entry.16:
Saturday

Lt Barr leaves for Camel Corps.

Lt Brown " " 2nd LH.

Appl to use Cpl Johnston for Cadillac Car.

Sgt Chanter reports in A car almost 

Lt Wordsworth arrives from Wardan

Stater 

1916
Entry.17:
Sunday.

Maj. Goncher leaves for Hospital.

Capt Hindhaugh & Lts Wordsworth, Chaffey, Henry & Bartley will leave with 64 others for School of Instruction.

Car driver Johnson laid up.
Entry.18:
To ASC & Bank re 8 ½ rations

Lt Mills & 50 ORs for 1st LH leave.
Entry.19:
M.O. W.L. Smith reports. 
Lt Mel
 

Capt Hudson & Lts Snow, Pledger & Pearce report with composite squadron from Mersa Matruk. 

To Maadi in evening. Met General Irving.
Entry.20: Lt Col Meredith came to camp, took over ‘A’ Sqn to inspect without reporting request. Borrowed car. 70 of 13th Reinf’s of 3rd LH report from Suez.
Entry.21:
Lt Ralston given commission to take prisoner to Mulla

Lt Col Meredith car till 2.30 PM. In town with QM.

Reported loss of 24 prs breeches & braces from QM Store.

11th

9 Drivers to A.S.C. train. 30 of
Entry.22:
Rem of 3rd LH report from Tasmania 

12th

Tried 2 cooks for stealing the Peaches: Convicted.

To Gezirah in afternoon.
Entry.23:
Sunday

To Maadi in afternoon.

Lt Gelling & 100(?) 14 of reinforcements of 1st LH arrive tonight.

14

Lt Kirsky & 18 others arrive from Weymouth.

To Gen Spens. Genl Irving, Gen’l Selheim in am ordered 50 meat dish trays. Going into matter of duty pay.

15 

Capt Stuckey to Beni Mazar as QM, area.

Lt Sinclair & 62 others of 2nd LH, LHFA, Bde HQ, & Supply Section 5th ASC to Minia

Visit from Garrison Adjt who appd of a site for 13th 

16

Major Goncher reported from overseas Base from Hosp.

Major Geyer & 6 officers & 266 reported in Letter from AMTS Cadillac Car.

17

Visit from Garrison Adjt: 13th LH Camp moved away from our lines: That unit made separate & distinct. Capt Hudson to Minich

18

Orders to assemble the 11th & 12th LH Regts.

Visitors from Meadi: & 11th & 12th 

19 

Capt Hudson 
arrived
 reported back from Minich. I attended Col Cox at Cont’l Hotel but on & off from 10.30am till 11.40PM to Helman in afternoon.

Orders to 11th & 12th to concentrate at Oasis Camp.

20

Sunday

Col Cox arrived in camp 9.30 am; attd Ch Pde left before lunch.

21

Gave orders to 11th & 12th re moving into Oasis Camp: tentage , & entire tents brought in by them worked out. Cheques made for full proportions of all registered funds

22 

11th &
Entry.24: out: Some tentage over Scale taken by
Entry.25:
LH. Major Parsons & I had Garrison Adjt over re matter, he was not in so I ask for Lt Col Gant to come with me on Wed: also asked Capt Mc for his CO. 

1916
Entry.26: Major Parsons & self attend garrison Adjt re tentage. G. Adjt stated as correct a scale which corresponded exactly with what they took ‘on scale’ from here.
Entry.27: to town. Lt Mossop sick leave to Maadi. Major Goncher sick leave to Alex.
Entry.28: Capt Stuckey returns from BAHNASA: Lt Snow sent from k 1st LH. Lt Campbell returns from el Hazat. Correspondence to provide men for Inf. & . Parade on same car, punctured tyre.
Entry.29: To Maadi with Capt Hudson to see Mossop.
Entry.32: Echelon: Major Corlette AE to pick Engineers.
Entry.35:
1

Major Goncher returns

Lt Sutton arrives with 17 O/R from England

Major Corlette to pick Engrs.
Entry.37:
LH 10 off & 470(?) O/R report in Camp

Lt Potts visited Camp.

Lt Mossop removed to hospital from Naadi

3

4

Saturday

To hospital to see Mossop: took Mr Slater to town: Grp.

5

To hospital to Mossop: to Naadi: lunch 6th LH: to Devonshires

Musketry Instruction for officers starts: Capt Hindburgh started riding test again. Lt Morris & 100 O/Rs and 13 of 2nd LH

6

Major Browne & 49 O/R arrive from England

Major Granville visits camp

7

Capt
 Lieut Mossop returns from hospital: Lt Tricket 2/Lt Major & 14 reinfts 2nd LH march in 

8

Lieut Lindrell returns to Reg. for Duty.

Major Lucas in camp fr FA/OAC men (4th & 5th Div)

Col Johnston 2nd DFA in camp to make enquiries. 

9

Col Johnston’s parade of 330 ASO. Rolls prepared. 

Lt Reid & 2nd Lt Semper sent to 3rd LH

10

Major Rabett makes enquiries: 4th & 5th Div FA.

Major Goncher leaves as Bde Major 3rd Bde

Major Browne leaves for 2nd LH service Regt.

11

Saturday

Lt F.A. Chaffey leaves for Base.

Major Robett & Col Cox Taylor in Camp for 4th &
Entry.38: D.A.C. a/RSM: a/RQMS: & 327 o/Rks to 2nd DAC. Dr Cutler to
Entry.40:
Church parade: to Maadi & Acher in 

13

 Lt Higgenbotham leaves for overseas base.

Major Rabett & Capt visits camp for officers.

To town on various business. 4 prisoners committed to Abbassia for safe custody.

14

Thro all S.Q.M.S. Stores & Post Offices (Sqn) with QM Lt Ross. Lt Col Cox Taylor and Maj Rabett & Capt Doolan: LtCol. C.T. addresses parade of about 1000 of those who had not so far volunteered for Artly. Very few volunteered.

Wired Brig Genl Cox for permission to apply for transfer to 4th Div F.A. & Mr Lindsell also wrote for permission

15

Brg Gen’l Cox’s permission by wire.

Rev Fernie leaves for Ismalia. To town in 

I apply for 4th DAC by wire & naming Lt Lindsell & Sutton: also write re letter on this.

To Mgr Birdas horse in , refuse to pay the
Entry.41:
LH their proportion of Regt. Funds as certain officers haven’t paid their mess bill. Three weeks old.

Copy of letter to OC 4th Div Fld Artillery. "May I have the honour to apply for command of your Div.Am Col. Your rep visiting this camp in quest of officers and men states the position is not yet filled, he thinks. My Bgdr – BS Cox has wired 

Mar 

15 

permission to do so & corresp. will follow wh. will show you his appl. I would say he recommended me for the pos. I now hold in Bde which shows on the laid down, the rank of Lt. Col. Reserve Regiments LH are not yet appd. tho I have been working in since
Entry.42:
I joined the LH (NSWL) in 1897: present age 39, having to leave Anzac (1LH 1/end for Egypt till July 29) I was sent to England & became supernumerary: on return I was given command this regt. I have no exp in detail of Dac work but am confident that that will prove no bar later on architect 

16 

Delivered rolls of 653 men & to Capt Rabett.

Called on Col Tunbridge & saw letter explaining that the Res Rgts of LH were cabled from Australia as "too expensive". Asked to be removed from the details. Changed organization in Camp to 1st ALH Bde details: See Routine Orders. Sutton sent to Tel el Kebir about his chance of getting into Artillery.

To Naadi in afternoon to see Mossop

Lt Co; Arnot & Maj Charlie visit Aerodrome.

17

Capt. Will. Med Off. Leaves for 22nd Howitzer Battry. 2nd Div.

Brought out in orders that 1st Res. Regt of LH would not be granted by Australia, on the score of expense.

18

Saturday

Instructed to send 6 officers & 54 of 1st LH & 3 off & of 2nd & 77 of
Entry.43:
LH South to their Service Regts.

To Maadi: McLean to K & St V. Telegram late that Genl Cox would be down. Major Goncher returns next morning from
Entry.45: Left Camp 7.30 Am: to railway stn to see the 170 old met Gen Cox He came to camp for few minutes. To town with him & Maadi all afternoon calling: dinner at night: saw Col Tunbridge together.
Entry.46:
Genl Cox goes to Ishmalia to see Hdqrts & Genl. CBB White. 

For him in evening I entertain Col Royston. Genl returns 9.30 PM.
Entry.47:
Tuesday

Interviewed by Col Tunbridge: 
with Genl Cox
 lunch with the General: dinner NSW Lancers at Continental.
Entry.49: To Barrage with Walsh. Lt Morris & Trickett return.
Entry.50:
Friday

Major Goucher & Lt Potts return from Sohag.
Entry.52:
Sunday

Rode to Maadi with Wight Goring, Gregor Hudson to Capt Caines mess. Their Artillery was going in am.
Entry.53: Capt Stuckey returned from Mimia. To town in Heliop . Lt Mossop returned to camp.
Entry.54:
Prepared list of NCOs for Training Regt 1st ALHBde

Lt Mossop to hospital.
Entry.56:
LH reports in Capt Muschamp reports

Lt Brooks reports from 3rd LH 

30

Lt Gatcliffe leaves for 5th D.A.

31

Major Goucher, Capt. Stickey, Lt Sutton. Morris, Trickett with 100 O/R of 1st 2nd & 3rd (300) leave for 14 days in Cairo Picquet.

April 1st

Saturday

G.S.C Col Wight & Goring
Entry.57:
Sunday

El Marg ride. 

Message from Garrison to be ready to move out at short notice.

3

Lt Samper 3rd LH to Artillery: General Cox CB in town. I met him at Continental a.m. Arrive in camp 4 30 PM: find instructions for units to move early next morning: work all night packing & getting troops away. Lt P Potts of AM
Entry.58:
Troops get away by 7.30 am: to town to pick up remaining business. Left QM about 20-50 hr

Catch 11.40 train with 2nd T Regt troops to Tel el Kebir.

Find camp laid out.
Entry.63:
Sunday 

 Church parade

10

To Cairo: rec’d letter from Col Tunbridge to OC Tig Camp "Send very urgent all Volunteers Artillery to 4th & 5th Divs" Gave to Capt A Phillips. Saw men in ‘a’ camp. Saw Lt Potts. Ordered O Mess kit for 4 D.A.C. Caught 6.15 train Tel el Kebir. 

1916
Entry.65: In Camp organized Artillery into Sections etc
Entry.67: Shown Self & Lt Lindsell’s transfer appl.
Entry.68:
Friday
: Self & Lt Lindsell go to Serapeum in evening,

Camp in empty tents of 4th D.A.C.: Jack & Walsh of 2nd LH.
Entry.69: Reported to Gen Rosenthal: Attached to 24th () Bde.
Entry.71:
Found the DAC Camp: took men in. No officers No baggage present or or tables etc.

Strength 2 Officers O/Rks.
Entry.72:
Organizing. Officers

9 officers reported: to come next day.

Officers reported MO reported

 19 20
Entry.73: Organizing: ½ holiday; drew some rifles
